Content: some NNs may assume that `assetchains.old` does not start HUSH, so there will need to be some adjusting by NNs whenever they want to use this stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
--- a/src/komodo_defs.h
+++ b/src/komodo_defs.h
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@
 #include "komodo_nk.h"

 #define ASSETCHAINS_MINHEIGHT 128
-#define ASSETCHAINS_MAX_ERAS 7
+#define ASSETCHAINS_MAX_ERAS 3
```

Content: I first read about this idea almost two years ago, the concept has been expanded a lot but still incomplete. Is it interesting? `A third alternative... is to use the usual zero-confirmation payment approach, but add a special feature to the transaction that will act as a forfeit, should the scammer attempt a double spend of the money that he sent to the merchant`  https://gist.github.com/awemany/619a5722d129dec25abf5de211d971bd I know channel-cc but for using with many recipient needs a system of liquidity hubs that don't exist yet, isn't it?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/williamsjoe/status/1149843075709231109

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: much talk of 10X engineers again, this meme isn't dead yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is funny?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c "10X engineer" is a very very divisive term in US silicon valley tech world

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: never heard of it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some people use it plainly, to mean a dev that is 10X or more productive than others

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but usually, it's used negatively

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is a big backlash against "rockstar devs" aka "10X engineer"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i.e. somebody that gets special treatment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why would 10x productivity be a negative?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in a corporation, everybody should fit the same cogs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you don't fig into your cog-wheel, bean counters get upset

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 10X engineers and "rockstars" don't fit

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why the insult?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: exp(x) engineer, more like it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, thats better. ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and of course, there are exp(-x) engineers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that ruin productivity of entire teams

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This thread, by an Indian startup guy is written at face value, he says 10X engineers are very valuable to very early startups: https://twitter.com/skirani/status/1149302828420067328

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and basically people are going wild, a lot of Social Justice Warrior type people, about how 10X engineers get special treatment and everybody should be treated the same/etc/etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why should an order(s) magnitude more productive dev not be treated like an entire 10 dev team?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/jessenoller/status/1149842895068811264

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sounds like jealousy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most anybody that works for 18hrs per day 7 days a week for 10 years straight can become a 10x or more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the trick is to make code one of the languages you "speak"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use the language processing everybody has

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: total immersion does the trick in most cases

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If everybody sits at their desk 8 hours, and reads all the company emails, why should they be treated any less than somebody that is 10X or more productive? That is their reasoning.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: When 99% of your employees are not 10X, you must keep the majority happy

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and most people just occupy space

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess professional sports players shouldnt get paid anymore than the weekend couch potato

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1150065560882941952

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is some subtle satire

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also, some very good advice at the ~10:00 mark

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: high level systems thinking and looking at how data flows thru the code, and how to optimize that

Author: michelvankessel#7656
Content: Hello! I have a quick question and would like to know if someone knows the answer. I am from the Blackcoin community and we are listed on BarterDEX v1. We would like to know if we get listed on BarterDEX v2 or if we have to be added to the list (again).  the community noticed BLK not being present on this list - https://www.atomicexplorer.com/#/coins

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: @michelvankessel Only a few coins are listed in the v2 beta and the number will be gradually increased with new releases. I suppose eventually the same coins will be listed as in v1

Author: michelvankessel#7656
Content: @KomodoWorld thank you for your prompt response. Please let me know if you want us to be part of the v2 beta. We have community members that would like to help

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I see you asked in #dev-marketmaker and someone will give you answer soon, maybe it can be added to one of next beta releases

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
i have a node that is on a wrong fork, on block 1444008 with longest chain 1444008.
how do i make it find the correct fork?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes, it uses coingecko in it's API as it's showing in footnote

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: *cointop

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Mylo is it updated?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @Mylo shouldn't restarting the daemon help? like it resolving the fork automatically. ðŸ¤” of course after updating

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: good point, maybe this node isn't.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Yea try just a restart after update if not try just `invalidateblock` the first block on the fork

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then reconsiderblock on the first block of the real chain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it definitely was not updated at the time of the fork, but it would be good to know how to fix a node in that situation without having to resync

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
ok thanks, may 4th last update.  long ago.
ok i had invalidateblock, missing the reconsiderblock for correct chain, thanks.   i haven't seen this in the fmanual ðŸ˜„

Content: @Alright this method worked!  @lukechilds maybe it will help you

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
> why should an order(s) magnitude more productive dev not be treated like an entire 10 dev team?

As a species we are incapable of treating ourselves fairly, or even in seeing ourselves fairly. 

Only when we're surrounded by and involved in pure Chaos do we ever approach true fairness.

 100,000 years of evolution and we total suck at manufacturing fairness.

I choose to punt. 

Let's colonize Europa, Mars, and Vega ASAP. 

The universe is but a trough of distractions for humans. 

There's probably some other parallel universe where all the aliens that can actually deal with facts live. They sent us here as a massive distraction to keep us from meddling in the affairs of inter-universal peace.
